00015 // constants

00017 #define JDATAVIEW_CELLMAX MAX_PATH_CHARS    // maximum number of chars in a cell, do not try to write more than 
00018                                             // this number to the text buffer supplied by the 'getcelltext' functions
00019 
00020 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_WIDTH 50
00021 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_MINWIDTH 50
00022 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_MAXWIDTH 100
00023 
00024 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_FONTSIZE 10
00025 
00026 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_MAXTEXTLEN 256
00027 
00028 // values for c_alignment
00029 
00030 enum {
00031     JCOLUMN_ALIGN_LEFT = 1,
00032     JCOLUMN_ALIGN_CENTER,
00033     JCOLUMN_ALIGN_RIGHT
00034 };
00035 
00036 enum {
00037     JCOLUMN_STYLE_PLAIN = 0,
00038     JCOLUMN_STYLE_BOLD = 1,
00039     JCOLUMN_STYLE_ITALIC = 2
00040 };
00041 
00042 enum {
00043     JCOLUMN_MOUSE_ENTER = 0,
00044     JCOLUMN_MOUSE_MOVE = 1,
00045     JCOLUMN_MOUSE_EXIT = 2
00046 };
00047 
00048 enum {
00049     JCOLUMN_SORTDIRECTION_FORWARD = 1,
00050     JCOLUMN_SORTDIRECTION_BACKWARD = 0
00051 };
00052 
00053 enum {
00054     JCOLUMN_INITIALLYSORTED_NONE = 0,
00055     JCOLUMN_INITIALLYSORTED_FORWARDS = 1,
00056     JCOLUMN_INITIALLYSORTED_BACKWARDS = 2
00057 };
00058 
00059 // kinds of JUCE component style columns (or cells within columns)
00060 
00061 enum {
00062     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_NONE = 0,
00063     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_CHECKBOX = 1,
00064     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_TEXTEDITOR = 2,       // eventually alphanumeric and numeric variants
00065     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_SLIDER = 3,
00066     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_COLOR = 4,
00067     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_MENU = 5
00068 };
00069 
00070 enum {
00071     JCOLUMN_MENU_INDEX = 1,                 // report index chosen instead of value of item
00072     JCOLUMN_MENU_FONTMENU = 2,              // flag for showing a font menu
00073     JCOLUMN_MENU_PAINT = 4,                 // cell is drawn with client paint method
00074     JCOLUMN_MENU_SELECT = 8,                    // row is selected on mouse down
00075     JCOLUMN_MENU_NOPANEL = 16,              // for font menu, don't include the show fonts item
00076     JCOLUMN_MENU_CLEARITEM = 32             // for font menu, include a clear item
00077 };
00078 
00079 enum {
00080     JCOLUMN_TEXT_ONESYMBOL = 1,
00081     JCOLUMN_TEXT_COMMASEPARATED = 2,
00082     JCOLUMN_TEXT_ICON = 4,
00083     JCOLUMN_TEXT_HASBUTTON = 8,
00084     JCOLUMN_TEXT_FILECHOOSEBUTTON = 16,
00085     JCOLUMN_TEXT_VIEWBUTTON = 32,
00086     JCOLUMN_TEXT_EDITBUTTON = 64,
00087     JCOLUMN_TEXT_TIME = 128,
00088     JCOLUMN_TEXT_FLOAT = 256,
00089     JCOLUMN_TEXT_INT = 512,
00090     JCOLUMN_TEXT_CANTEDIT = 1024,
00091     JCOLUMN_TEXT_FONTSIZE = 2048
00092 };
00093 
00094 enum {
00095     JCOLUMN_SLIDER_NOTEXTBOX = 1,
00096     JCOLUMN_SLIDER_ZERO_TO_ONE = 2
00097 };

00102 /** A dataview cell description.
00103     @ingroup    jdataview   */
00104 typedef struct _celldesc
00105 {
00106     long row;
00107     long col;
00108     long data;
00109 } t_celldesc;
00110 
00111 
00112 /** A dataview column.
00113     Columns for a given dataview are stored in a #t_hashtab and accessed by name.
00114     @ingroup    jdataview   */
00115 typedef struct _col 
00116 {
00117     t_object c_obj;
00118     void *obex;
00119     t_symbol *c_name;           ///< column name (hash)
00120     t_object *c_dv;             ///< parent dataview
00121     int c_id;                   ///< id in DataViewComponent
00122     long c_width;               ///< column width in pixels
00123     long c_maxwidth;            ///< max column width
00124     long c_minwidth;            ///< min column width
00125     char c_autosize;            ///< determine width of text column automatically (true/false)
00126     char c_alignment;           ///< display of text, left, right, center
00127     t_symbol *c_font;           ///< name of font
00128     long c_fontsize;            ///< font size (points?)
00129     t_symbol *c_label;          ///< heading of column
00130     char c_separator;           ///< separator mode
00131     char c_button;              ///< column has a button (true/false)
00132     t_symbol *c_buttonlabel;    ///< text in a button
00133     t_symbol *c_customsort;     ///< message sent to sort this column -- if none, default sorting is used based on value c_numeric
00134     char c_overridesort;        ///< if true only the sortdata method is called, not the sort method (true/false)
00135     t_symbol *c_custompaint;    ///< send this msg name to client to paint this column
00136     t_symbol *c_valuemsg;       ///< message sent when a component mode cell's value changes
00137     t_symbol *c_beginmsg;       ///< message sent when a component mode cell's value is about to start changing
00138     t_symbol *c_endmsg;         ///< message sent when a component mode cell's value is finished changing
00139     t_symbol *c_rowcomponentmsg;///< message sent to determine what kind of component should be created for each cell in a column
00140     t_symbol *c_custommenuset;  ///< message to set a menu (for a readonly or custompaint column)
00141     t_symbol *c_custommenuresult;   ///< message sent when an item is chosen from a custom menu
00142     char c_editable;            ///< can you edit the data in a cell in this column
00143     char c_selectable;          ///< can select the data in a cell in this column (possibly without being able to edit)
00144     char c_multiselectable;     ///< can you select more than one cell in this column
00145     char c_sortable;            ///< can you click on a column heading to sort the data
00146     long c_initiallysorted;     ///< if this is set to JCOLUMN_INITIALLYSORTED_FORWARDS the column is displayed with the sort triangle
00147     long c_maxtextlen;          ///< maximum text length: this is used to allocate a buffer to pass to gettext (but there is also a constant)
00148     long c_sortdirection;       ///< 0 for ascending, 1 for descending
00149     long c_component;           ///< enum of components (check box etc.)
00150     char c_canselect;           ///< can select entire column
00151     char c_cancut;              ///< can cut/clear entire column
00152     char c_cancopy;             ///< can copy entire column
00153     char c_cancutcells;         ///< can cut a single cell (assumes "editable" or "selectable") (probably won't be implemented)
00154     char c_cancopycells;        ///< can copy a single cell
00155     char c_canpastecells;       ///< can paste into a single cell
00156     char c_hideable;            ///< can the column be hidden
00157     char c_hidden;              ///< is the column hidden (set/get)
00158     char c_numeric;             ///< is the data numeric (i.e., is getcellvalue implemented)
00159     char c_draggable;           ///< can drag the column to rearrange it
00160     char c_casesensitive;       ///< use case sensitive sorting (applies only to default text sorting)
00161     void *c_reference;          ///< reference for the use of the client
00162     double c_indentspacing;     ///< amount of space (in pixels) for one indent level
00163     t_symbol *c_insertbefore;   ///< name of column before which this one should have been inserted (used only once)
00164     t_symbol *c_cellcluemsg;    ///< message to send requesting clue text for a cell
00165     t_symbol *c_celltextcolormsg;   ///< message to get the cell's text color
00166     t_symbol *c_celltextstylemsg;   ///< message to get the cell's style and alignment
00167 } t_jcolumn;
00168 
00169 
00170 /** The dataview object.
00171     @ingroup    jdataview   */
00172 typedef struct _jdataview
00173 {
00174     t_object d_obj;
00175     void *obex;
00176     t_linklist *d_components;   ///< list of DataViewComponents showing this dataview
00177     t_object *d_client;         ///< object that will be sent messages to get data to display
00178     t_hashtab *d_columns;       ///< columns -- point to t_jcolumn objects
00179     t_hashtab *d_id2columns;    ///< columns from column IDs
00180     t_linklist *d_colorder;     ///< current order of columns
00181     t_indexmap *d_rowmap;       ///< collection of rows (including number of rows)
00182     long d_numcols;             ///< number of columns
00183     double d_rowheight;         ///< fixed height of a row in pixels
00184     char d_autoheight;          ///< height determined by font
00185     char d_hierarchical;        ///< does it allow hierarchical disclosure (true / false) -- not implemented yet
00186     t_jrgba d_rowcolor1;        ///< odd row color (striped)
00187     t_jrgba d_rowcolor2;        ///< even row color
00188     t_jrgba d_selectcolor;      ///< color when rows are selected
00189     t_jrgba d_bordercolor;      ///< border color
00190     char d_bordercolorset;      ///< was border color set? if not, use JUCE default
00191     char d_canselectmultiple;   ///< multiple rows are selectable
00192     char d_cancopy;             ///< copy enabled
00193     char d_cancut;              ///< cut / clear enabled
00194     char d_canpaste;            ///< paste enabled
00195     char d_canrearrangerows;    ///< rows can be dragged to rearrange -- may not be implemented yet
00196     char d_canrearrangecolumns; ///< columns can be dragged to rearrange
00197     long d_viscount;            ///< number of visible views of this dataview
00198     long d_inset;               ///< inset for table inside containing component in pixels
00199     char d_autosizeright;       ///< right side autosizes when top-level component changes
00200     char d_autosizebottom;      ///< bottom autosizes when top-level component changes
00201     char d_dragenabled;         ///< enabled for dragging (as in drag and drop)
00202     t_symbol *d_fontname;       ///< font name
00203     double d_fontsize;          ///< font size
00204     t_symbol *d_colheadercluemsg;   ///< message to send requesting clue text for the column headers
00205     char d_autosizerightcolumn; ///< right column should stretch to remaining width of the dataview, regardless of column width
00206     char d_customselectcolor;       ///< send getcellcolor message to draw selected cell, don't use select color
00207     void *d_qelem;              ///< defer updating
00208     double d_colheaderheight;
00209     char d_drawgrid;
00210     long d_top_inset;           ///< vertical inset for row background (default 0)
00211     long d_bottom_inset;        ///< vertical inset for row background (default 0)
00212     long d_borderthickness;     ///< border line thickness default 0 for no border
00213     char d_keyfocusable;        ///< notify component to grab some keys
00214     char d_enabledeletekey;     ///< delete key will delete selected rows
00215     char d_usegradient;         ///< color rows with gradient between rowcolor1 (top) and rowcolor2 (bottom)
00216     char d_inchange;            ///< in change flag for inspector end-change protection system
00217     char d_horizscrollvisible;  ///< is horizontal scroll bar visible
00218     char d_vertscrollvisible;   ///< is vertical scroll bar visible
00219     char d_scrollvisset;        ///< has the scroll visibility ever been changed since the dv was created?
00220     char d_overridefocus;       ///< override default focus behavior where ListBox is focused when assigning focus to the dataview
00221     char d_usesystemfont;       ///< use system font (true by default)
00222     t_object *d_searchcolumn;   ///< column we ask for celltext in order to navigate the selection via the keyboard
00223     t_object *d_returnkeycolumn;///< column that is sent the return key when a given row is selected
00224     void *d_navcache;           ///< sorted list of column strings for key navigation
00225     char d_usecharheight;       ///< use font specified in points rather than pixels (default is pixels)
00226 } t_jdataview;
00227 
00228 
00229 // private -- used to notify a component of a jdataview change
00230 typedef struct _jdv_notifier
00231 {
00232     t_jdataview *n_dataview;
00233     t_symbol *n_what;
00234     void *n_data;
00235 } t_jdv_notifier;

00238 /** used to pass data to a client sort function 
00239     @ingroup    jdataview   */
00240 typedef struct _privatesortrec
00241 {
00242     t_jcolumn *p_col;       ///< column object to sort
00243     char p_fwd;             ///< 1 if sorting "forwards"
00244     t_object *p_client;     ///< pointer to the client object
00245     t_jdataview *p_dv;      ///< pointer to the dataview
00246 } t_privatesortrec;

00253 /** Create a dataview.  
00254     You should free it with object_free().
00255     @ingroup    jdataview
00256     @return     A pointer to the new instance.  */
00257 void *jdataview_new(void);
00258 
00259 
00260 /** Set a dataview's client.
00261     The client is the object to which the dataview will send messages to get data,
00262     notify of changes to cells, etc.
00263     Typically this is the object in which you are creating the dataview.
00264     @ingroup        jdataview
00265     @param  dv      The dataview instance.
00266     @param  client  The object to be assigned as the dataview's client. */
00267 void jdataview_setclient(t_object *dv, t_object *client);
00268 
00269 /** Get a pointer to a dataview's client.
00270     The client is the object to which the dataview will send messages to get data,
00271     notify of changes to cells, etc.
00272     @ingroup        jdataview
00273     @param  dv      The dataview instance.
00274     @return         A pointer to the dataview's client object.  */
00275 t_object *jdataview_getclient(t_object *dv);

00460 // define a column based on a dictionary

00463 
00464 // adding rows
00465 
00466 // a row reference is a way of distinguishing a row to the owning object. This is up to the object whose data is being displayed.
00467 // for example, it could be a pointer to an entry in a database
00468 // or if you are displaying attributes it could be a symbol
00469 
00470 typedef void *t_rowref;
00471 
00472 void jdataview_addrow(t_object *dv, t_rowref rr);
00473 void jdataview_addrows(t_object *dv, long count, t_rowref *rrs);

00482 t_rowref *jdataview_getselectedrows(t_object *dv);

00554 // DataViewComponent calls this for a custom paint method for a column
00555 
00556 void jdataview_clientpaintcell(t_object *dv, t_symbol *msg, t_object *pv, int columnId, int rowNumber, int width, int height, int rowIsSelected);
00557 
00558 // custom paint method should be declared as:
00559 // void myobject_paint(t_myobject *x, t_object *patcherview, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, int width, int height, int rowIsSelected)
00560 // to obtain the graphics context call patcherview_getjgraphics() on the patcherview arg
00561 // use jcolumn_setcustompaint to set the message symbol for this method for a column
00562 
00563 // the jdataview doesn't hold data. It just sends messages to an owning object to display it
00564 // the messages may be cached for speed. The first level interface just defines a textual
00565 // display. Eventually there will be a custom component for a row.
00566 
00567 // sorting: columns can be textual (c_numeric == 0) or numeric or they can define a custom sort
00568 // method by calling jcolumn_setcustomsort to a symbol. This symbol names a method that will be
00569 // called to sort the data for this column. It is of the form:
00570 // long myobject_sort(t_rowref a, t_rowref b) -- which will be passed two rowrefs. In addition,
00571 // custom sort clients need to implement the sortdata message, which is passed a pointer to
00572 // a t_privatesortrec. It needs to store this statically as it is sent before the custom sort message is
00573 // received.
00574 void jdataview_getcolumnmenuforcell(t_object *dv, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, long *argc, t_atom **argv, char **enabled);
00575 void jdataview_cellcolumnmenuresult(t_object *dv, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, long result);
00576 
00577 void jdataview_sortcolumn(t_object *x, t_symbol *colname, int fwd);
00578 void jdataview_sort(t_object *x, t_symbol *colname, int fwd);
00579 void jdataview_resort(t_object *x);
00580 long jdataview_getsortcolumn(t_object *x);
00581

00583

00586 void jdataview_selectcolumn(t_jdataview *x, t_symbol *colname);
00587 void jdataview_selectallrows(t_jdataview *x);
00588 
00589 long jdataview_iscellselected(t_jdataview *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);

00591 long jdataview_iscolumnselected(t_jdataview *x, t_symbol *colname);

00619 /*
00620 
00621 -- "columncreated": notification of a column being created
00622 
00623 void myobject_columncreated(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname);
00624 
00625 -- "rowadded" / "rowdeleted": notification of a row being added / deleted
00626 
00627 void myobject_rowadded(t_myobject *x, t_rowref rr);
00628 void myobject_rowdeleted(t_myobject *x, t_rowref rr);
00629 
00630 -- "sortstarted": notification of a sort starting (will get sort messages)
00631 
00632 void myobject_sortstarted(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, long direction);
00633 
00634 -- "compare": sort the data according to column / direction, return 1 if r1 > r2, -1 if r2 > r1
00635 
00636 long myobject_compare(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, long direction, t_rowref r1, t_rowref r2);
00637 
00638 -- "gettext": get string to show in a cell
00639 
00640 void myobject_gettext(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, char *text);
00641 
00642 -- "editstarted": notification that editing is starting in a cell
00643 
00644 void myobject_editstarted(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);
00645 
00646 -- "editentered": editing has finished and here is some new text for a cell
00647 
00648 void myobject_editenter(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, char *newtext);
00649 
00650 // plus, a message specific to a button clicked in a cell (this allows for multiple buttons per column)
00651 
00652 void myobject_buttonmessage(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, t_symbol *msg);
00653

00655

00658 void myobject_pastecell(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);

00679 
00680 // implementation notes:
00681 
00682 JUCE refreshComponentForCell needs to have the ability to create a custom component given a
00683 class name. How can that be done, with templates? 
00684 
00685 Yes you can use template argument passed to new, i.e.,
00686 
00687 template<class T>
00688 blah<T>::blah
00689 {
00690     foo (which could be a member of blah?) = new T;
00691 }
00692 
00693 */
00694 
00695 END_USING_C_LINKAGE
